Surely the ending wasn't bleeped because of the networks. The South Park episodes are made in less than a week, and they usually send them to the networks one or a few days before they are to air. So the networks may not always be prepared for something 'very shocking' and may not even realize that it was 'very shocking' until ignorant persons have made big deals about and over nothing. So the networks probably heard from some scare spreading media source that they now have 6.900.000.000 death threats if they don't censor those dangerous pixels or tiny lights showing animated colors. I would think Stone and Parker are informed ahead of time if something is to be censored, but I'm not sure. If they had been this time they probably said 'ok, but only if you'll also censor all the speeches at the ending'. There might not even have been dialogue written for that scene. Maybe they were just counting on the censorship from the networks and decided to answer back this way, pointing out the ridiculousness in outbeeping to everyone once and for all... (yeah, right). They might even have been surprised that the first episode wasn't censored.
Or maybe they made a deal with the networks that they could only censor one of the two episodes and so the networks chose the second episode in hope that a lot of people wouldn't see the first episode, rather than censoring the first episode to make people curious and interested thus build up a wider audience for the thrilling conclusion of the 200th 'censored South Park episode', in which uncensored Mohammeds would be like a punchline to last week's riddle so to speak, which would then, to highly sensitive people, appear to be a 'distasteful joke'. Buuut anyway, there's nothing for me to make a point about.

SPOILER ALERT FOR OVERLY SENSITIVE SENSITIVIANS: Just go ahead and enjoy the sweet notes of Barbra Streisand. Sounds like a feedback-ridden distorted guitar mixed with a slowed down burp. Nice notes after "I still miss you at neeight-eh".

Trey Parker and Matt Stone didn't bleep out anything. Comedy Central censored everything because they got a threat from a New York muslim group called Revolution Muslim and they had sent death threats to Stone and Parker. Bc of this the studio decided to censor everything. Parker and Stone didn't even know about it till it aired. Also their not showing it online either and all of the repeats that were supposed to happen got cancelled and instead their showing old episodes.

Parker & Stone made an announcement saying that the beeping was entirely CC's work and denied the rumours about the whole thing being a "Not Without My Anus" style joke. I guess this pretty much settles the joke/censorship debate for now. CC should be ashamed of themselves and the executives who ordered the beeping should be fed their own shit and thrown to the pigs. Fuck the cowards.

Here's the truth. The following was quoted from this page:
http://www.southparkstudios.com/news/3878

Posted on: 04.22.10
A Statement from Matt and Trey
In the 14 years we've been doing South Park we have never done a show that we couldn't stand behind. We delivered our version of the show to Comedy Central and they made a determination to alter the episode. It wasn't some meta-joke on our part. Comedy Central added the bleeps. In fact, Kyle's customary final speech was about intimidation and fear. It didn't mention Muhammad at all but it got bleeped too. We'll be back next week with a whole new show about something completely different and we'll see what happens to it.

All I can say is stay strong Matt and Trey, the south park community is behind you 100%. What a fucking classic scenario... make fun of us and we'll kill you. This country and the media in general in a majority of the world is based on the idea and exchange of free speech and ideals, I find it sad that out of all the issues islam is facing they chose to single out a CARTOON as a threat.
